name: SUNY Albany 496 / 596
short_description:
This is a undergrad/graduate course introducting the principles & practices of open source software & communities or practice: History, Intellectual Rights, Economics &  Community Pracitces. The course begins with the study of economics & various business models of open source, in particular, clarifying the apparent contradiction between free flow of information and the funding & compensation of participants. From there the course then covers copyright/patents,/trademarks/licensing and basic concepts of contracts. The social and behavioral aspects of open source communities are covered to help understand the motivations that drive participants & to become familiar with the mechanisms used to encourage & foster active participation. Throughout the course, hands-on activities using open source technoloies are performed in order to develop skills on the practices of participation.
